Dispute_Type: Patent and trademark rights dispute following termination of distributorship agreement
Legal_Issue: Whether MATRIX infringed the '619 patent or the SOLARWALL trademark
Evidence_Assessment: Expert testimonies, analysis of technical specifications
Decision_Outcome: No patent or trademark infringement occurred
Legal_Rule: Patent and trademark infringement under Canadian law
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged infringement of '619 patent and unauthorized use of SOLARWALL trademark
Key_Evidence_Considered: Technical differences in air inlet placement
Post-agreement use of trademark without deceptive intent
Legal_Framework: Statutory interpretation of Patent Act and Trade-marks Act
Court_Result: Action dismissed with costs against plaintiffs
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal statutes: Patent Act and Trade-marks Act
Defendant_Response: Denial of infringement, based on technological differences and lack of consumer confusion
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, expert testimony, technical analysis
Remedy_Sought: Legal and equitable relief for alleged IP infringement
Legal_Provision: Patent Act, s. 42; Trade-marks Act, s. 20
Claimant_Status: Rights holder of '619 patent and SOLARWALL trademark
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of essential similarity in patented design
Governing_Rule: Patent and trademark infringement standards under Canadian law
